    • registerTeamSubmit

      @PostMapping("/register") public String registerTeamSubmit(@ModelAttribute TeamForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It takes a TeamForm object, converts it to a Team object, and saves it to the database
      Parameters:
      form - The form object that will be used to populate the model.
      model - This is the model that will be passed to the view.
      redirAttrs - This is a RedirectAttributes object that allows us to pass attributes to the next request.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the list page.

    • listTeams

      @GetMapping("/list") public String listTeams(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      It gets the best scorer and if it's present, it adds it to the model, otherwise it adds null The list of teams is also added to the model to be displayed
      Parameters:
      model - The model is a Map that is used to pass data to the view.
      Returns:
      A list of teams ordered by points.

    • getTeamLogo

      @GetMapping("/logo") public String getTeamLogo(@RequestParam(name="id") int id, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      "Get the logo of the team with the given id and return it as a response." The first thing we do is set the content type of the response to "image/png". This is the content type of the image we're going to return
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the team to get the logo for
      response - The response object that will be used to send the image to the client.
      redirAttrs - This is a RedirectAttributes object that allows us to pass attributes to the redirected page.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the error page.

    • updateTeamLogo

    • updateTeamLogo

      @PostMapping("/edit/logo") public String updateTeamLogo(@RequestParam(name="id") int id, @ModelAttribute TeamForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It takes the id of the team, the form object, the model object and the redirect attributes object as parameters. It then tries to update the team logo with the new logo from the form object. If it succeeds, it redirects to the team profile page with a success message. If it fails, it redirects to the team profile page with an error message
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the team to be updated
      form - the form object that contains the multipart file
      model - This is the model object that is used to pass data from the controller to the view.
      redirAttrs - This is a RedirectAttributes object that allows us to pass attributes to the redirected page.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the team profile page.
